title: NERP'D
subtitle: Understanding Preparedness Incase Things Go Wrong

about.aboutContent:
The Nuclear Emergency Preparedness Index examines and analyzes the preparedness based on the distance to the nearest available infarastructure and services (listed below) by Dissemination Blocks (DB). This index has been prepared using the Region of Durham's Open Data. A weighted approach to the components has been applied and then standardized based on the DB's distance from the Nuclear Power Plant.

Domains and Indicators

Health Services Domain

Distance to Hospitals

Distance to Regional Paramedic Services

Distance to Pharmacies


Evacuation Domain

Distance to Community Centres

Distance to Highways


Essential Services Domain

Distance to Food, Grocery Supplies 

Distance to Essential Services like Hardware Stores, Gas Stations

Welcome to NERP'D!

This app has been designed to identify and explore the spatial variation is how prepared different parts of the Durham Region are in case of a nuclear emergency. 

The majority of the analysis in this app is focused on the Nuclear Emergency Preparedness Index (NEPI). Use the  widget to learn about NEPI in detail. 


Compare NEPI 

  • This is the most important feature in the app that allows users to compare how NEPI varies based on each Nuclear Power Plant. 
  • Note: Ensure that both NEPI layers are turned on before using this feature. 

Find Nearby Infrastructure  

  • These three widgets have been designed for users to locate nearby infrastructure (list below).
  • Infrastructure and Services under each widget
    • Nearby Health Services : Paramedic Services, Hospitals, Pharmacies
    • Nearby Evacuation Services: Community Centres, Highways
    • Nearby Essential Services: Groceries, Gas Stations, Hardware Stores
  • Note: You can change the default radius (i.e. 5 km) by dragging the bar to right or left.
